title: Book 1 - The First Dream
description: Your adventure as a Dreamer begins

Prologue|The First Frost
Lord Allant quickly surveyed the madness of the battlefield around him; the barbarian horde had them vastly outnumbered, yet still his ancients stood
Across the battlefield he could just make out Khelani, an imposing figure even among the ancients. She whirled through the enemy ranks with her twin axes in a frightening blur of steel and blood
Three distinct horns sounded in the distance; Allant knew that meant another charge from the barbarian horsemen and a rising cloud of dust revealed the source of the attack
Eyes and shields to the south!
Allant flared his feathery wings and bellowed as two ancients immediately rushed to his side and braced for impact
The approaching horsemen would have been an imposing sight to most men, but not Allant and his ancients standing a powerful 8 feet tall
As the cavalry drew closer, Allant tried to gauge the resolve of his foes, reading the faces of the approaching barbarians
He saw traces of uncertainty, even fear, however they were far from breaking. Allant felt regret knowing many more would need to die before this would be over
The sound of the approaching horses grew louder until Allant could feel the pounding vibrations through the cracked earth
And then silence
Complete silence
Allant felt paralysed as a bitterly cold wind swept across him. The horsemen, now just a few feet away, had been enveloped in a thick layer of frost and seemed frozen in place
Unable to turn his head, Allant could only just stretch the corner of his vision to see Khelani locked in a large block of ice, her axe buried deep into the chest of a similarly frozen barbarian
The battlefield, moments ago a chaotic melee, now seemed oddly peaceful
Sudden movement on the frozen battlefield caught Allants eye; shadowy reflections flickering off the icy tombs that encased all
Many at first, the shadows began to coalesce into a figure; large and elongated, but resembling something human
The dark figure floated effortlessly a few inches off the ground and began moving toward Allant in a hauntingly graceful way
Allant’s heart raced as he felt a fear born of helplessness for the first time since his ascension
The creature stopped in between Allant and the horsemen, turning its head back and forth between the two
Close call
The voice was thick and gravely, with a hint of amusement, and Allant could now see the face of a man; a mixture of a smooth pale complexion and corrupted black scarring, and bright green eyes
Long black hair lined the man's face, mixing seamlessly with the tattered black robes
Not that it matters, you’ll all be...hers soon
And how do you feel now, ancient, as helpless as the day you were born?
The man smiled again and cocked his head, as if hearing something
Yes, yes.
The man sighed and turned back to Allant, his dark red eyes narrowing
I do wish she’d let me have more fun, it's not often this happens after all
Hesitating only for a moment, the man placed his clawed left hand on the ice covering Allant and black tendrils of smoke began to exude across the surface of the ice
Allant panicked. The barbarian horde had been an enemy that made sense; it wasn't the first generation of people whose discontent with the ancients rule had led them to attempt an uprising
The most unsettling part was that Allant hadn't seen anything of this new enemy in his dreams
The shadows crept around him until they almost completely blocked out light, just a small strip of sunlight struggling through
And then total darkness
Chapter 1|3000 Years Later
You awake covered in sweat, your throat dry and sore
The dream still lingers in your mind. It had felt so real, and you shiver despite the warm summer morning
Argus, the stout and always jovial dwarf, is lighting a fire but stops as he notices your distress
You ok, $name? Look like you’ve seen a ghost!
.#TALKED_ABOUT_DREAM=Tell him about the dream|KEPT_DREAM_TO_SELF=Make an excuse
I had a dream of some ancient battleground, the warriors of both sides had been encased in ice...
and something...or someone...powerful, who brought darkness
The memory of the dream is already hazy; you haven't been doing this long after all
You'd always had odd dreams but had only learned recently that you qualified as a Dreamer, gifted with the ability to see events in both the past and future
But this dream felt different, unrelated to your current mission and the people involved seemed alien
Argus looks at you for a moment, concerned, then shrugs and rubs the skin around his eyepatch
Don't give too much stock to it young one, I'm sure they don't all come true
He pats you reassuringly on the shoulder, his jovial tone comforting you
However, you can't help but sense some uncertainty in him
Vara, the tall, stern elf with mousy-brown hair and a large scar across her neck, breaks the awkward silence
Is that fear I sense, Argus? And here I thought you were fearless!
Argus immediately grins and winks at you
Aha, easy now Vara, I never quite said fearless! I have one fear ... you!
Vara gives back her usual half-smile. As serious as she can be, you can tell she enjoys the banter
It seemed better to keep this dream to yourself for now, it felt different from your usual dreams which revealed recent events from the past or near-future
Nothing, just a headache
Argus frowns, then nods and rubs the skin around his eye patch
Same. A few too many wines round the campfire last night eh? Don't worry, Vara will look after us!
You feel a soft thump as a skin of water lands in your lap, and you look up to see the elf
She is tall with long mousy-brown hair, conventionally beautiful except for the large, intimidating scars along her neck and face
Drink that, it will help you shake it off
She says in her usual, matter-of-fact manner
You sense a hidden meaning to her words, however she quickly moves away to tend to other things
Looking over, you see the twins, Jimmy and Tasha, packing up their things. They both give you a reassuring smile and motion for you to hurry up
You get the feeling that you're the only one who didn't sleep well, but you begin packing up your things
Not that there is much to pack up; your bedding, a simple short sword your barely know how to use, and most importantly your pouch of sleeping tonic
As a Dreamer you often struggled to feel rested after sleep, and the tonic was the only thing that helped shut out the more intrusive dreams
It only takes a few minutes for your group to pack up camp and continue on your journey towards the village of Wellspring
You've been travelling with this group for three days now, as part of your contract with the mercenary company, Chain of Swords
Taskmaster Peele had assigned you, and these four others, to investigate a supposed demonic cult in the area
Apparently the church in your hometown, Freeport, had sent a priest named father Aemon to investigate two weeks prior, but he hadn't been heard from since
This was your first real assignment with other Attuned, which made you nervous, but the people you found yourself with seemed friendly enough
Argus and Vara, the Protectors, made a great pair; at face value they were polar opposites, but they got along far better than they’d ever care to admit
The twins Jimmy and Tasha on the other hand often seemed like the same person; finishing each-others thoughts in an eccentric manner. They were Shifters, who always tended to be an odd lot
Protectors were those Attuned with short-term foresight, which gave them the ability to predict another persons immediate intentions; a noticeable advantage in a fight
Shifters on the other hand were able to alter the intentions of others through suggestion; this tended to be more useful in cases were diplomacy was required
The day goes by quickly as you listen to stories from the other members of the group. Sadly, Vara refuses to reveal how she got her many scars
Argus interrupts the questioning and takes his opportunity to shift attention back to him
Want to know how I got the eye patch?
You hear Vara groan dramatically, but she looks relieved to have the focus shift from her scar
Argus smiles and puts on a dramatic voice
I'm not usually one to brag about this, but I was quite the hearthrob in my younger days
One summer I got the attention of the crown princess Ivenha herself! Approached me at a party she did
Of course, it would had been mighty rude of me to turn her away, so we talked, and drank - oh she could drink!
Argus pauses for a moment and seems lost in the memory, before catching himself
But! The king, well, he didn't like his daughter mingling with a commoner like me...
You notice a glimmer of moisture in the boisterous dwarf's eyes, and sense something more to this story
When I refused to stop seeing her, the bastard had me arrested took my eye as punishment!
Argus barks a laugh as he proclaims this, while Jimmy and Tasha seem totally captivated
You suddenly notice a plume of smoke rising in the direction of your destination
Vara also seems to have noticed, and instinctively places her hands on her sheathed knives
We're almost there, but it looks like we're heading into trouble
Tasha sighs heavily and a deep frown appears on her usually happy face
I was really hoping for a peaceful one this time round
Argus pats her on the back a little too forcefully
I wasn't!
And with almost a gleeful expression, he charges off ahead
Chapter 2|Wellspring
By the time you arrive, the flames are dancing across the town of Wellspring uncontrollably
Argus turns as he notices the rest of you approach
Seems we might be a wee bit late...
Vara nods, then begins scanning the buildings to assess the situation
We must hurry, if we can't find the priest we won't be getting paid for this one
She looks over the group, her eyes resting on you
Dreamer, I know you're new, but can you give us any information?
You'd only recently learned it was possible to use your gifts to read situations; a way to shift your consciousness and see glimpses of the past
I can try
You shut your eyes and attempt to focus on something
.#READ_WELLSPRING_PRIEST=Focus on the priest|READ_WELLSPRING_FIRE=Focus on the fire
You try to relax your mind, allowing your consciousness to slip away
The sound of the fire and pressure of everyone watching makes it difficult, so you attempt to push that out of your mind
Focusing on the priest, as he had been described to you, you picture an old man with short white hair in the white and blue robes of Marr
You feel a strong gust of wind hit you and suddenly you are watching this old man, he is arguing with another
The other man is tall and stocky, has a full dark brown beard and wears a somewhat dirty apron
Their voices are muffled and impossible to make out through sound of rushing wind, but it is clear they disagree
The priest points down the street to other end of town where a large, lone house sits on a hill
The other man hesitates for a moment, contemplating something and looks back towards another building, a tavern
Looking back at the priest the man shakes his head and enters the tavern
The priest looks furious at first, then just disappointed, before turning and walking in the direction he previously pointed
Focusing on the fire, you try to picture the flames and understand what caused it
